Uses of Class
fast3d.math.Vector2d

  • Packages that use Vector2d 
    Package Description
    fast3d.graphics  
    fast3d.math  
    fast3d.renderables  
    fast3d.util.serial  

    • Uses of Vector2d in fast3d.graphics

      Methods in fast3d.graphics that return Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2d Texture.getDimension() 
      Vector2d Graphics3d.shade(Vector3d v)
      converts one given vertex in pixel-coordinates
      faster than getShader().shade(vertices) because of buffering-features
      if a vertex is shaded to null according to the camera-mode-settings, this method will return null too
      Methods in fast3d.graphics that return types with arguments of type Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Graphics3d.shadeAll(Vector3d... vecs)
      converts all given vertices in pixel-coordinates
      faster than getShader().shade(vertices) because of buffering-features
      if a vertex is shaded to null according to the camera-mode-settings, it won't be added to the return-list
      Methods in fast3d.graphics with parameters of type Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Color Texture.getAbsolute(Vector2d coord)
      gives the color for a given pixel on the texture
      the coordinates are within 0..width or 0..height (overflow is managed automatically)
      Color Texture.getLogical(Vector2d coord)
      gives the color for a given pixel on the texture
      the coordinates are within 0..1 (overflow is managed automatically)
      void Texture.toAbsoluteCoordinate(Vector2d logicalCoordinate)
      converts the given logical coordinate (max = 1) to the corresponding absolute coordinate on this texture (max = width or height)
      void Texture.toLogicalCoordinate(Vector2d absCoordinate)
      converts the given absolute coordinate on this texture (max = width or height) to the corresponding logical coordinate (max = 1)

    • Uses of Vector2d in fast3d.math

      Fields in fast3d.math declared as Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector2d Vector3d.shaded
      to shade a vertex means to calculate its position on a viewers camera-screen
      to not calculate that multiple times for one image, the shaded position can be buffered here
      Methods in fast3d.math that return Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2d Vector2d.add(Vector2d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector2d Vector2d.calculateAverage(Vector2d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      Vector2d Vector3d.clipTo2dXY()
      just cut off the z-coordinate
      Vector2d Vector3d.clipTo2dXZ()
      just cut off the y-coordinate
      Vector2d Vector3d.clipTo2dYZ()
      just cut off the x-coordinate
      Vector2d Vector2d.clone() 
      Vector2d Vector2d.constrain(double min, double max)
      constrains the coordinates to the given range
      if a coordinate is lower than min, it will be set to min
      if a coordinate is higher than max, it will be set to max
      after this method call all coordinates will be within the interval [min,max], including the limits
      Vector2d Vector2d.constrainLength(double min, double max)
      constrains the length to the given range
      if this length is lower than min, it will be scaled to min
      if this length is higher than max, it will be scaled to max
      Vector2d Vector2d.invert()
      inverts this vector
      this will point in the opposite direction, but with the same length
      Vector2d Vector2d.multiply(Vector2d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.normalize()
      scales the vector to the length 1
      fails (does nothing than) for the zero-vector
      static Vector2d Vector2d.one() 
      static Vector2d Vector2d.random() 
      static Vector2d Vector2d.right() 
      Vector2d Vector2d.scale(double k)
      enlarges the vector by k, it's direction will be constant
      for k between 0 and 1, the vector will be shortened
      for negative k the vector will be inverted and then enlarged by positive k
      Vector2d Vector2d.scaleTo(double length)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      Vector2d Vector2d.scaleTo(Vector2d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector2d Vector2d.set(double x, double y)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      Vector2d Vector2d.set(Vector2d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.setCoordinates(double[] vec)
      counterpart to getCoordinates
      sets the coordinates of this to x=[0], y=[1]
      Vector2d Vector2d.setToZero()
      sets all coordinates to 0
      Vector2d Shader.shadeVertex(Vector3d vertex)
      shades a single vertex
      returns null if the vertex is not visible on the screen (does not correspond to the camera-mode-setting)
      Vector2d Shader.shadeVertexIgnoreMode(Vector3d vertex)
      shades a single vertex
      returns the screen-projection-position of it even if the vertex is out of bounds of the screen or false oriented
      returns never null
      Vector2d Vector2d.sub(Vector2d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.to(Vector2d t)
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.toCartesian()
      converts this vectors polar coordinates (x=angle, y=distance) to Cartesian coordinates toCartesian().toPolar() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
      Vector2d Vector2d.toPolar()
      converts this vectors Cartesian coordinates to polar coordinates
      a polar coordinates representation is given by an angle (new x-coordinate) and a distance (new y-coordinate) from the coordinate-center toPolar().toCartesian() should cause no change unless a rounding mistake
      static Vector2d Vector2d.up() 
      static Vector2d Vector2d.x()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as x-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector2d Vector2d.y()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as y-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector2d Vector2d.zero() 
      Methods in fast3d.math that return types with arguments of type Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Shader.shade(java.util.List<Vector3d> vertices)
      shades all vertices
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Shader.shade(Vector3d... vertices)
      shades all vertices
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Shader.shadeIgnoreMode(java.util.List<Vector3d> vertices)
      shades all vertices
      returns a pixel coordinate for every given vertex
      java.util.List<Vector2d> Shader.shadeIgnoreMode(Vector3d... vertices)
      shades all vertices
      returns a pixel coordinate for every given vertex
      Methods in fast3d.math with parameters of type Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2d Vector2d.add(Vector2d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector2d.angleTo(Vector2d v)
      calculates the angle between this and the parameter-vector in radiant
      both vectors are direction-vectors and for that calculation interpreted as arrows laying on the 3d-space-origin
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector2d Vector2d.calculateAverage(Vector2d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      double Vector2d.distanceTo(Vector2d target)
      calculates the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector2d.distanceToSquared(Vector2d target)
      calculates the square of the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector2d.dotP(Vector2d v)
      calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
      does not change the parameter
      static double Vector2d.dotP(Vector2d a, Vector2d b)
      calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
      does not change the parameter
      static double Vector2d.getRatio(Vector2d a, Vector2d b)
      returns the ratio between the two given parallel vectors or Double.NaN if they are not parallel
      if given vectors a and b the ratio is defined as:
      a = ratio * b so that ratio = a / b;
      static boolean Vector2d.isFinite(Vector2d v)
      checks whether the given vector is not null and all it's coordinates are finite
      boolean Vector2d.isParallel(Vector2d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      boolean Vector2d.isSameOrientated(Vector2d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction and orientation
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.multiply(Vector2d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.scaleTo(Vector2d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector2d Vector2d.set(Vector2d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.sub(Vector2d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector2d Vector2d.to(Vector2d t)
      does not change the parameter

    • Uses of Vector2d in fast3d.util.serial

      Methods in fast3d.util.serial that return Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector2d VecBinaryReader.read2()
      reads the vectors double-coordinates and generates a single vector from them
      Vector2d[] VecBinaryReader.read2(int amount)
      reads all needed double-coordinates and generates vectors of them
      Methods in fast3d.util.serial with parameters of type Vector2d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean VecBinaryWriter.write(Vector2d... vecs)
      serializes and writes all given vectors to the stream
      in fact this does just write the coordinates of the given vectors as doubles
